Someone to Lose You

oblivion that you don't wanna see

Someone to Lose You

Lyrics

love, ephemera
all it could ever be
oblivion that you don’t want to see
tell me one time all that i’m going to do
if i tell myself i’ll never be parted from you

well it’s the 21st century
i think i’d better stop telling myself
together is never gonna stop

maybe i’ll leave you, or maybe you’ll leave me
or part with a kiss before succumbing
glad that you’re here
maybe you can help me see how to make my peace
with all that i will never be

Lyrics and music copyright (c) 2015 John Dylan

Appears on

Someone to Lose You (Single)

Multitrack Isolations

You can download the following multitrack isolations for “Someone to Lose You,” sample them, or create remixes of them, and you are free to release the results commercially. For more information, see the Open Source Music Approach.

  • Someone to Lose You (Bass Only)
  • Someone to Lose You (Karaoke/Instrumental)
  • Someone to Lose You (Vocals Only/A Capella)
  • Someone to Lose You (Guitar Only)
  • Someone to Lose You (Drums Only)
